intro: Euphorbia haeleeleana, commonly known as the Haeleeleana spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which are adapted to arid environments. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Euphorbia haeleeleana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience in dry conditions.
